meanings.definition: In a direct line of descent from an ancestor.
meanings.sent1: She is lineally related to her great-grandmother, who was her ancestor.
meanings.sent2: The prince is lineally connected to the royal family through his father.
meanings.sent3: The family tree showed how they were lineally linked through generations.
meanings.sent4: The inheritance passed lineally from father to son for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The bloodline was traced lineally back to the first king of the land.

meanings.definition: In a straight line or course.
meanings.sent1: The rocket flew lineally towards the moon without deviating.
meanings.sent2: The road stretched lineally ahead, disappearing into the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased the laser pointer lineally across the room.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze traveled lineally from one end of the painting to the other.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed lineally through the valley, carving its path over time.
